message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SI, cs.NA 

This paper deals with the problem of recovering a complete matrix from a sparse representation, which is a fundamental problem in dictionary learning and has applications in signal processing and machine learning. The paper proposes a novel algorithmic pipeline based on nonconvex optimization with a spherical constraint, which is naturally phrased in the language of manifold optimization. This suggests that the paper is likely to be relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including information theory (cs.IT), machine learning (cs.LG), computer vision (cs.CV), scientific computing (cs.SI), and numerical analysis (cs.NA).
